card.name: Abolish
card.ability:
You may discard a Plains card rather than pay Abolish's mana cost.
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: As war raged on, the young mages became more direct in their tactics, often at great cost.

card.name: Agent of Shauku
card.ability: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a land: Target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Go ahead. Take it. You'll be so very powerful . . . and what harm can it do?"

card.name: Alexi, Zephyr Mage
card.ability: {X}{U}, {T}, Discard two cards: Return X target creatures to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: The Keldons didn't know her name, but they still cursed her in battle.

card.name: Alexi's Cloak
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"Doesn't look like much, does it?"
—Alexi, zephyr mage
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : Any Auras already on the creature remain.

card.name: Aura Fracture
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: Jamuraa's rhystic mages treat magic as their garden, uprooting unwanted spells as bothersome weeds.

card.name: Avatar of Fury
card.ability:
If an opponent controls seven or more lands, Avatar of Fury costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
{R}: Avatar of Fury gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {R}{R} to cast it.

card.name: Avatar of Hope
card.ability:
If you have 3 or less life, Avatar of Hope costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
Avatar of Hope can block any number of creatures.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {W}{W} to cast it.

card.name: Avatar of Might
card.ability:
If an opponent controls at least four more creatures than you, Avatar of Might costs {6} less to cast.
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {G}{G} to cast it.

card.name: Avatar of Will
card.ability:
If an opponent has no cards in hand, Avatar of Will costs {6} less to cast.
Flying
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {U}{U} to cast it.

card.name: Avatar of Woe
card.ability:
If there are ten or more creature cards total in all graveyards, Avatar of Woe costs {6} less to cast.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The converted mana cost of this card is still 8, even if you only pay {B}{B} to cast it.

card.name: Barbed Field
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to target creature or player."
card.flavor: Wherever they went, the Keldons transformed the land into a weapon.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Land are normally colorless, so effects that care about the color of the damage's source will not find a color.

card.name: Blessed Wind
card.ability: Target player's life total becomes 20.
card.flavor:
"The fourth wind of ascension is Anointer, deifying the worthy."
—Keld Triumphant
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This counts as gaining or losing life as appropriate.

card.name: Bog Elemental
card.ability:
Protection from white
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Bog Elemental unless you sacrifice a land.
card.flavor:
"When the bog walks, the wise run."
—Erissa, bog witch

card.name: Bog Glider
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice a land: Search your library for a Mercenary permanent card with converted mana cost 2 or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Branded Brawlers
card.ability:
Branded Brawlers can't attack if defending player controls an untapped land.
Branded Brawlers can't block if you control an untapped land.
card.flavor:
"The sword or the lash. Choose."
—Akul, Keldon whip sergeant

card.name: Brutal Suppression
card.ability: Activated abilities of nontoken Rebels cost an additional "Sacrifice a land" to activate.
card.flavor:
"They no longer care about their own suffering. Show them something worse."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

card.name: Calming Verse
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments you don't control. Then, if you control an untapped land, destroy all enchantments you control.
card.flavor: The chattering forest fell silent as the otherworldly song began.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks if you control an untapped land during resolution.

card.name: Celestial Convergence
card.ability:
Celestial Convergence enters the battlefield with seven omen counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove an omen counter from Celestial Convergence. If there are no omen counters on Celestial Convergence, the player with the highest life total wins the game. If two or more players are tied for highest life total, the game is a draw.

card.name: Chilling Apparition
card.ability:
{B}: Regenerate Chilling Apparition.
Whenever Chilling Apparition deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: Mortal minds shrivel at its touch.

card.name: Chimeric Idol
card.ability: {0}: Tap all lands you control. Chimeric Idol becomes a 3/3 Turtle artifact creature until end of turn.
card.flavor: After a chimeric idol attacked them, the Keldons smashed all unfamiliar statues.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Your lands are tapped as part of the effect, not part of the cost.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Citadel of Pain
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's end step, Citadel of Pain deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"Battle is our religion. This fortress is our temple."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It counts the untapped lands on resolution.

card.name: Coastal Hornclaw
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Coastal Hornclaw gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Jamuraan farmers fear three things above all else: droughts, floods, and hornclaws.

card.name: Coffin Puppets
card.ability: Sacrifice two lands: Return Coffin Puppets from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if you control a Swamp.
card.flavor: The ground won't accept them.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability works even if you sacrifice your last swamp to activate it. It only checks for a swamp on activation.

card.name: Copper-Leaf Angel
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice X lands: Put X +1/+1 counters on Copper-Leaf Angel.
card.flavor:
"When Serra made angels, people called her a goddess. My angels are far superior to hers."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : X can be zero.

card.name: Darba
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Darba unless you pay {G}{G}.
card.flavor: Legend has it the darba gave up its wings in return for an extra stomach.

card.name: Death Charmer
card.ability: Whenever Death Charmer deals combat damage to a creature, that creature's controller loses 2 life unless he or she pays {2}.
card.flavor: It vents the chill of the grave.

card.name: Denying Wind
card.ability: Search target player's library for up to seven cards and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor:
"The third wind of ascension is Eliminator, clearing Keld's path to victory."
—Keld Triumphant

card.name: Despoil
card.ability: Destroy target land. Its controller loses 2 life.
card.flavor: Nothing could grow where the vile smoke had been, and no one could breathe it and live.

card.name: Devastate
card.ability: Destroy target land. Devastate deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
card.flavor:
"You're willing to die for your homeland. I'm willing to kill for it."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

card.name: Diving Griffin
card.ability: Flying, vigilance
card.flavor:
To outrace the griffin
—Kipamu expression meaning
"to do the impossible"

card.name: Dual Nature
card.ability:
Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield, its controller puts a token that's a copy of that creature onto the battlefield.
Whenever a nontoken creature leaves the battlefield, exile all tokens with the same name as that creature.
When Dual Nature leaves the battlefield, exile all tokens put onto the battlefield with Dual Nature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If Dual Nature leaves the battlefield between when it triggers and when a token is put onto the battlefield, that token remains on the battlefield indefinitely. It missed the separate ability which would have exiled the token.
10/4/2004 : If the original creature has any "enters the battlefield" abilities, the copy will also have those.
8/1/2008 : If a Legendary creature enters the battlefield, the token is put onto the battlefield and then both it and the original creature are sent to the graveyard by the Legend rule before any player can take any actions.
10/1/2009 : The token is not considered to have been kicked, even if the creature it's a copy of was kicked.

card.name: Elephant Resurgence
card.ability: Each player puts a green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield. Those creatures have "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in its controller's graveyard."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The token creatures' power and toughness continuously adjust. They are not "locked in" when the spell resolves. This is because the tokens get an ability, rather than simply having their power and toughness set.

card.name: Endbringer's Revel
card.ability: {4}: Return target creature card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: First death. Then Shauku.

card.name: Entangler
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can block any number of creatures.
card.flavor: "Tell me again," said Latulla, raising her fist, "how just one woman held back an entire Keldon platoon."

card.name: Excavation
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice a land: Draw a card. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
"There are secrets out there begging to be rediscovered. We just need to look in the right places."
—Teferi, planeswalker

card.name: Excise
card.ability: Exile target attacking creature unless its controller pays {X}.
card.flavor:
"Creation is no great feat. Anything you make, I can unmake in a heartbeat."
—Alexi, zephyr mage
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature's controller gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Fault Riders
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Fault Riders gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: They turn geological upheaval into tactical advantage.

card.name: Fen Stalker
card.ability: Fen Stalker has fear as long as you control no untapped lands. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: As silent as a shadow, and just as hard to flee.

card.name: Fickle Efreet
card.ability: Whenever Fickle Efreet attacks or blocks, flip a coin at end of combat. If you lose the flip, an opponent gains control of Fickle Efreet.
card.flavor: Flame chooses its own course.

card.name: Flameshot
card.ability:
You may discard a Mountain card rather than pay Flameshot's mana cost.
Flameshot deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

card.name: Flay
card.ability: Target player discards a card at random. Then that player discards another card at random unless he or she pays {1}.
card.flavor: The Keldons would never admit it, but Greel unsettles them, too.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The player gets to see the first discard before choosing whether or not to pay.
10/4/2004 : The player gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Flowering Field
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn."
card.flavor: Some lands are soothing, and their peace can be felt in the soul.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The land's controller gets to activate the ability.

card.name: Foil
card.ability:
You may discard an Island card and another card rather than pay Foil's mana cost.
Counter target spell.

card.name: Forgotten Harvest
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile a land card from your graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

card.name: Glittering Lion
card.ability:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lion.
{3}: Until end of turn, Glittering Lion loses "Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lion." Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Glittering Lynx
card.ability:
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lynx.
{2}: Until end of turn, Glittering Lynx loses "Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Glittering Lynx." Any player may activate this ability.

card.name: Greel, Mind Raker
card.ability: {X}{B}, {T}, Discard two cards: Target player discards X cards at random.
card.flavor: "You're Latulla's gift to me, and I always play with my presents."

card.name: Greel's Caress
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -3/-0.
card.flavor: Greel's grin is far less loathsome than his touch.

card.name: Gulf Squid
card.ability: When Gulf Squid enters the battlefield, tap all lands target player controls.
card.flavor: If it could capture the power it wastes, it would be invincible.

card.name: Hazy Homunculus
card.ability: Hazy Homunculus is unblockable as long as defending player controls an untapped land.
card.flavor: They hide in dreams and whispers and faraway thoughts.

card.name: Heightened Awareness
card.ability:
As Heightened Awareness enters the battlefield, discard your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
card.flavor:
"It startles me how alive one feels on the edge of death."
—Barrin, master wizard

card.name: Hollow Warrior
card.ability: Hollow Warrior can't attack or block unless you tap an untapped creature you control not declared as an attacking or blocking creature this combat.
card.flavor: Though it moves like a living thing, anyone can tell it lacks a soul—not to mention mercy.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This card can't tap itself to allow itself to attack or block. You have to tap a different creature which is not being declared as an attacker or blocker.

card.name: Infernal Genesis
card.ability: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then he or she puts X 1/1 black Minion creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that card's converted mana cost.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : If the card has no mana cost (for instance, if it's a land), then its converted mana cost is 0. This means no tokens will be created.

card.name: Inflame
card.ability: Inflame deals 2 damage to each creature dealt damage this turn.
card.flavor: Wound, maim, kill: it's all the same to a Keldon.

card.name: Jeweled Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice two lands: Jeweled Spirit gains protection from artifacts or from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: As he knows all the world completely, the world refuses him harm.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color (or artifacts) on resolution.

card.name: Jolrael, Empress of Beasts
card.ability: {2}{G}, {T}, Discard two cards: All lands target player controls become 3/3 creatures until end of turn. They're still lands.
card.flavor: "I need no army. I have Jamuraa."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Only affects lands the target player controls when the ability resolves.
10/4/2004 : The lands do not get a creature type.
10/4/2004 : The lands retain their abilities.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Jolrael's Favor
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
{1}{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.
card.flavor:
"War destroys; nature renews."
—Jolrael, empress of beasts

card.name: Keldon Arsonist
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice two lands: Destroy target land.
card.flavor:
"Fields can be replanted. Settlements can be rebuilt. Burn it all."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

card.name: Keldon Battlewagon
card.ability:
Trample
Keldon Battlewagon can't block.
When Keldon Battlewagon attacks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
Tap an untapped creature you control: Keldon Battlewagon gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the power of the creature tapped this way.

card.name: Keldon Berserker
card.ability: Whenever Keldon Berserker attacks, if you control no untapped lands, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: They fight beyond thought, beyond fear, and beyond mercy.

card.name: Keldon Firebombers
card.ability: When Keldon Firebombers enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices all lands he or she controls except for three.
card.flavor:
"If there isn't enough of Jamuraa left to stand on, I will still claim it for Keld."
—Latulla, Keldon overseer

card.name: Latulla, Keldon Overseer
card.ability: {X}{R}, {T}, Discard two cards: Latulla, Keldon Overseer deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Everything around her suffers."
—Haddad, Kipamu soldier
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : X can be zero.

card.name: Latulla's Orders
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to defending player, you may destroy target artifact that player controls.

card.name: Lesser Gargadon
card.ability: Whenever Lesser Gargadon attacks or blocks, sacrifice a land.
card.flavor:
Trod on by a gargadon
—Kipamu expression meaning
"wiped out"

card.name: Living Terrain
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land is a 5/6 green Treefolk creature that's still a land.
card.flavor: Keldons were accustomed to rugged terrain, but they never expected it to be aggressive.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does give the land a color and creature type, which is unlike most other ways to animate a land.
10/4/2004 : This can be placed on any land, not just Forests.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Mageta the Lion
card.ability: {2}{W}{W}, {T}, Discard two cards: Destroy all creatures except for Mageta the Lion. Those creatures can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: In the jungle of war there is always a Lion.

card.name: Mageta's Boon
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
card.flavor:
When the Lion roars, his cubs grow stronger.
—Kipamu saying

card.name: Mana Vapors
card.ability: Lands target player controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.
card.flavor: The scent of magic can rob you of your senses, blinding you to the world.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : No land controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes lands which entered the battlefield after Mana Vapors resolved.

card.name: Marsh Boa
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: Though a powerful constrictor, it prefers simply to drown its prey.

card.name: Mercenary Informer
card.ability:
Mercenary Informer can't be the target of black spells or abilities from black sources.
{2}{W}: Put target nontoken Mercenary on the bottom of its owner's library.
card.flavor: The problem with rebels is that they so quickly reject authority.

card.name: Mine Bearer
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Mine Bearer: Destroy target attacking creature.
card.flavor: "The Keldons may have explosive tempers, but I have explosives."

card.name: Mirror Strike
card.ability: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn by target unblocked creature is dealt to its controller instead.
card.flavor:
"Enemies can be your weapons or your shields. Simply show them which they are."
—The Teachings of Zho

card.name: Mungha Wurm
card.ability: You can't untap more than one land during your untap step.
card.flavor: Cities have crumbled under its weight.

card.name: Nakaya Shade
card.ability: {B}: Nakaya Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.
card.flavor: Made strong by reckless magic. Made horrid by reckless strife.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each player gets the option to pay when the ability resolves.

card.name: Noxious Field
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: This land deals 1 damage to each creature and each player."
card.flavor: Ultimately, it became a three-way battle: the land attacked both armies.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Land are normally colorless, so effects that care about the color of the damage's source will not find a color.

card.name: Outbreak
card.ability:
You may discard a Swamp card rather than pay Outbreak's mana cost.
Choose a creature type. All creatures of that type get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: This plague chooses its victims.

card.name: Overburden
card.ability: Whenever a player puts a nontoken creature onto the battlefield, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: The Kipamu League knew what Keld refused to acknowledge: the land could support no more.

card.name: Panic Attack
card.ability: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.
card.flavor: Sometimes everyone decides to go for help at the same time.

card.name: Pit Raptor
card.ability:
Flying, first strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Pit Raptor unless you pay {2}{B}{B}.

card.name: Plague Fiend
card.ability: Whenever Plague Fiend deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature unless its controller pays {2}.
card.flavor: As the strange plague ravaged Jamuraa, the fiends multiplied.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature's controller gets the option to pay when the triggered ability resolves.

card.name: Plague Wind
card.ability: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant

card.name: Psychic Theft
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it and exile that card. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. At the beginning of the next end step, if you haven't cast the card, return it to its owner's hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The card is revealed to all players while it is exiled.
10/4/2004 : You can cast the Instant or Sorcery during the End step after you put the "at the beginning of the end step" trigger on the stack, as long as you do so before that trigger resolves.
10/4/2004 : The card may only be cast once. Once it is announced and put on the stack, the card is no longer exiled and the effect of Psychic Theft ends.

card.name: Pygmy Razorback
card.ability: Trample
card.flavor: As a rite of passage, Kipamu youths taunt razorbacks with long sticks . . . then flee.

card.name: Quicksilver Wall
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{4}: Return Quicksilver Wall to its owner's hand. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: "Ogg hit wall. Ogg no kill wall. Ogg hate wall"

card.name: Rebel Informer
card.ability:
Rebel Informer can't be the target of white spells or abilities from white sources.
{3}: Put target nontoken Rebel on the bottom of its owner's library.
card.flavor: The problem with mercenaries is that if you can buy their loyalty, others can too.

card.name: Rethink
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is its converted mana cost.
card.flavor: "Are you sure you want to do that?"
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Reveille Squad
card.ability: Whenever one or more creatures attack you, if Reveille Squad is untapped, you may untap all creatures you control.
card.flavor: "To arms To arms The Lion roars"

card.name: Rhystic Cave
card.ability: {T}: Choose a color. Add one mana of that color to your mana pool unless any player pays {1}. Activate this ability only any time you could cast an instant.
card.flavor:
"All mages dip into the same well; some are just in more of a hurry."
—Alexi, zephyr mage
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a player pays {1}, Rhystic Cave does not produce any mana, but is still considered to have been tapped for mana. Things which trigger of the land being tapped for mana will trigger, but things which try to replace mana production will have nothing to replace.
10/4/2004 : Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.
10/4/2004 : The card's ability has errata so you can't activate the ability during casting of a spell or activating of an ability. This prevents you from getting into a position where someone paying {1} could stop you from having enough mana to pay for the spell. If you want to use it pay for a spell or ability, you need to use this card before you start the casting or activating.

card.name: Rhystic Circle
card.ability: {1}: Any player may pay {1}. If no one does, the next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: The circle buys time—an important commodity in battle.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can't be used to prevent damage to your creatures, just to you.

card.name: Rhystic Deluge
card.ability: {U}: Tap target creature unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor:
"I'll rain down on you with the power of magic itself. Then we'll see who prevails."
—Alexi, zephyr mage
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

card.name: Rhystic Lightning
card.ability: Rhystic Lightning deals 4 damage to target creature or player unless that creature's controller or that player pays {2}. If he or she does, Rhystic Lightning deals 2 damage to the creature or player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The player gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Rhystic Scrying
card.ability: Draw three cards. Then, if any player pays {2}, discard three cards.
card.flavor:
"The trick is to ask when no one's listening."
—Alexi, zephyr mage
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Rhystic Shield
card.ability: Creatures you control get +0/+1 until end of turn. They get an additional +0/+2 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.
card.flavor: A shield for one is good. A shield for everyone is even better.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Only affects creatures you control when it resolves.
10/4/2004 : Each player (starting with the current player and going in turn order) gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Rhystic Study
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, you may draw a card unless that player pays {1}.
card.flavor: Friends teach what you want to know. Enemies teach what you need to know.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The player gets the option to pay when this triggered ability resolves. This will be after the spell is announced, but before it resolves.
10/4/2004 : You don't have to decide whether or not you are drawing until after the player decides whether or not to pay.

card.name: Rhystic Syphon
card.ability: Unless target player pays {3}, he or she loses 5 life and you gain 5 life.
card.flavor: Jamuraan wizards are linked together by magic, a bond that only the wicked dare exploit.

card.name: Rhystic Tutor
card.ability: Unless any player pays {2}, search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Any lock can be undone, any secret revealed.

card.name: Rib Cage Spider
card.ability: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor: Everything it sees it considers food—and with that many eyes, it's not liable to miss much.

card.name: Ribbon Snake
card.ability:
Flying
{2}: Ribbon Snake loses flying until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: All snakes slither. Only this one soars.

card.name: Ridgeline Rager
card.ability: {R}: Ridgeline Rager gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: While armies battled across Jamuraa, beasts stalked the high places looking for victims.

card.name: Root Cage
card.ability: Mercenaries don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor: The Vintara Forest welcomes its enemies with a crushing embrace.

card.name: Samite Sanctuary
card.ability: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
Our war is against suffering, not against those who cause it.
—Samite creed

card.name: Scoria Cat
card.ability: Scoria Cat gets +3/+3 as long as you control no untapped lands.
card.flavor: Like a volcano, it too can erupt without warning.

card.name: Search for Survivors
card.ability: Reorder your graveyard at random. An opponent chooses a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, exile it.
card.flavor: There's no rest for a Keldon.

card.name: Searing Wind
card.ability: Searing Wind deals 10 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"The first wind of ascension is Forger, burning away impurity."
—Keld Triumphant

card.name: Sheltering Prayers
card.ability: Basic lands each player controls have shroud as long as that player controls three or fewer lands. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: "It matters not if the gods hear my prayers. Jamuraa does."

card.name: Shield Dancer
card.ability: {2}{W}: The next time target attacking creature would deal combat damage to Shield Dancer this turn, that creature deals that damage to itself instead.
card.flavor: The harder your strike, the stronger her defense.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the ability is used twice, it will cause the next two attacks this turn (which only happens if something gives a player two attacks) from the creature to "reflect" back to itself. It will not result in double damage back from a single attack.

card.name: Shrouded Serpent
card.ability: Whenever Shrouded Serpent attacks, defending player may pay {4}. If he or she doesn't, Shrouded Serpent is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: Many travelers have wandered into a fog only to find that it had teeth, claws, and an appetite.

card.name: Silt Crawler
card.ability: When Silt Crawler enters the battlefield, tap all lands you control.
card.flavor: If they could replenish the land instead of draining it, Jamuraa would be teeming with them.

card.name: Snag
card.ability:
You may discard a Forest card rather than pay Snag's mana cost.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by unblocked creatures this turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : You may discard any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even discard a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

card.name: Soul Charmer
card.ability: Whenever Soul Charmer deals combat damage to a creature, you gain 2 life unless that creature's controller pays {2}.
card.flavor: She seeks the warmth of the living.

card.name: Soul Strings
card.ability: Return two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand unless any player pays {X}.
card.flavor: Everyone is manipulated. It's just more obvious with the dead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each player gets the option to pay when this spell resolves.

card.name: Spiketail Drake
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice Spiketail Drake: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
card.flavor: "The spell will have to wait," said Alexi, pointing up. "Drakes."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

card.name: Spiketail Hatchling
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Sacrifice Spiketail Hatchling: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: It dodges waves of water to prepare for waves of magic.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The spell's controller gets the option to pay when this ability resolves.

card.name: Spitting Spider
card.ability:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Sacrifice a land: Spitting Spider deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.

card.name: Spore Frog
card.ability: Sacrifice Spore Frog: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor: The end of one life is merely the beginning of thousands more.

card.name: Spur Grappler
card.ability: Spur Grappler gets +2/+1 as long as you control no untapped lands.
card.flavor: Grapplers hunt in packs, driving their victims over steep mountain cliffs.

card.name: Squirrel Wrangler
card.ability:
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Put two 1/1 green Squirrel creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice a land: Squirrel creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Gnawed to death. Bad way to go."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only affects Squirrels on the battlefield when the ability resolves.

card.name: Steal Strength
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: With each grunt of pain from Haddad, Greel's grin widened.

card.name: Stormwatch Eagle
card.ability:
Flying
Sacrifice a land: Return Stormwatch Eagle to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: When eagles leave the sky, sailors leave the sea.

card.name: Sunken Field
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}."
card.flavor: The land is heavy with promise, the harvest ripe with betrayal.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The spell's controller gets the option to pay when the ability resolves.

card.name: Sword Dancer
card.ability: {W}{W}: Target attacking creature gets -1/-0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Most soldiers think of the sword as a weapon. In the hands of Zho monks, swords are also the strongest of shields.

card.name: Task Mage Assembly
card.ability:
When there are no creatures on the battlefield, sacrifice Task Mage Assembly.
{2}: Task Mage Assembly deals 1 damage to target creature. Any player may activate this ability but only any time he or she could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Thresher Beast
card.ability: Whenever Thresher Beast becomes blocked, defending player sacrifices a land.
card.flavor: It destroys everything in its path, including the path itself.

card.name: Thrive
card.ability: Put a +1/+1 counter on each of X target creatures.
card.flavor: "We wait and watch, and as we prepare for war, we grow strong."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means X different creatures. You can't give more than one +1/+1 counter to a creature with this spell.

card.name: Trenching Steed
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Trenching Steed gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Keldons took several of the steeds as trophies of war. They'd never seen such a light beast stand so firm.

card.name: Troubled Healer
card.ability: Sacrifice a land: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: "Which is worse: nothing to defend, or no one to defend it?"

card.name: Troublesome Spirit
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your end step, tap all lands you control.
card.flavor: As erratic and turbulent as a summer squall.

card.name: Verdant Field
card.ability:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor: Jolrael tends the land so that the land will tend the beasts.

card.name: Veteran Brawlers
card.ability:
Veteran Brawlers can't attack if defending player controls an untapped land.
Veteran Brawlers can't block if you control an untapped land.
card.flavor: Death awaits them on both fronts.

card.name: Vintara Elephant
card.ability:
Trample
{3}: Vintara Elephant loses trample until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: Trained with the aid of rhystic magic, they become uneasy in its absence.

card.name: Vintara Snapper
card.ability: Vintara Snapper has shroud as long as you control no untapped lands. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"The snapper is still when all else moves
And strikes when all are dozing."
—Tales of the Vintara Forest

card.name: Vitalizing Wind
card.ability: Creatures you control get +7/+7 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The fifth wind of ascension is Exalter, fulfilling Keld's destiny."
—Keld Triumphant
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only affects creatures you control when the spell resolves.

card.name: Wall of Vipers
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{3}: Destroy Wall of Vipers and target creature it's blocking. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor:
What wall can never be climbed, but is always scaled?
—Nakaya riddle

card.name: Well of Discovery
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if you control no untapped lands, draw a card.
card.flavor:
When you have given everything, then you are capable of anything.
—Well inscription

card.name: Well of Life
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, if you control no untapped lands, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor:
When you have given everything, then you have everything to gain.
—Well inscription

card.name: Whip Sergeant
card.ability: {R}: Target creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack this turn.)
card.flavor: Keldon soldiers learn to move faster than the whip.

card.name: Whipstitched Zombie
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Whipstitched Zombie unless you pay {B}.
card.flavor: Pity the tailor.

card.name: Wild Might
card.ability: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. That creature gets an additional +4/+4 until end of turn unless any player pays {2}.
card.flavor: The hunted can become the fiercest hunters.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Each player gets the option to pay when the spell resolves.

card.name: Windscouter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Windscouter attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
card.flavor: These nimble ships were designed for hit-and-run tactics.

card.name: Wing Storm
card.ability: Wing Storm deals damage to each player equal to twice the number of creatures with flying that player controls.
card.flavor: A thousand wings beating as one can choke the sky itself.

card.name: Wintermoon Mesa
card.ability:
Wintermoon Mesa enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Wintermoon Mesa: Tap two target lands.
card.flavor:
Dark is light and day is night
When the winter moon shines.

card.name: Withdraw
card.ability: Return target creature to its owner's hand. Then return another target creature to its owner's hand unless its controller pays {1}.
card.flavor: "We outnumber them Charge Charge Hey, where'd you guys go? Retreat Retreat"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The creature's controller gets the option to pay when the spell resolves.
10/4/2004 : The two creatures may have different controllers.
10/4/2004 : Must target two different creatures.
10/4/2004 : You choose on announcement which creature is the one that can be paid to prevent the effect. The payment itself is made on resolution (if at all).

card.name: Zerapa Minotaur
card.ability:
First strike
{2}: Zerapa Minotaur loses first strike until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: There's no difference between bone and crystal when it's piercing your throat.
